{"step_by_step_thinking": "Iron is a crucial element in many biological processes. It is present in myoglobin, a protein that helps your heart and muscle cells store oxygen. It is also present in cytochrome, a group of proteins essential for cellular respiration. Catalase, an enzyme that breaks down hydrogen peroxide into water and oxygen in our bodies, also contains iron. However, pyruvate kinase, an enzyme involved in glycolysis, does not contain iron.", "answer_choice": "D"}
